text: {{Infobox settlement |official_name = Mobaye |other_name = |native_name = |nickname = |settlement_type = |motto = |image_skyline = |imagesize = |image_caption = |image_flag = |image_blank_emblem = |blank_emblem_type = |blank_emblem_size = |image_map = |mapsize = |map_caption = |image_map1 = |mapsize1 = |map_caption1 = |image_dot_map = |dot_mapsize = |dot_map_caption = |dot_x = |dot_y = |pushpin_map = Central African Republic |pushpin_label_position =bottom |pushpin_map_caption =Location in Central African Republic |subdivision_type = Country |subdivision_name = Central African Republic |subdivision_type1 = Prefecture |subdivision_name1 = Basse- Kotto |subdivision_type2 = District |subdivision_name2 = |subdivision_type3 = |subdivision_name3 = |subdivision_type4 = |subdivision_name4 = |government_footnotes = |government_type = |leader_title = |leader_name = |leader_title1 = |leader_name1 = |leader_title2 = |leader_name2 = |leader_title3 = |leader_name3 = |leader_title4 = |leader_name4 = |established_title = |established_date = |established_title2 = |established_date2 = |established_title3 = |established_date3 = |area_magnitude = |unit_pref =Imperial |area_footnotes = |area_total_km2 = |area_land_km2 = |area_water_km2 = |area_total_sq_mi = |area_land_sq_mi = |area_water_sq_mi = |area_water_percent = |area_urban_km2 = |area_urban_sq_mi = |area_metro_km2 = |area_metro_sq_mi = |area_blank1_title = |area_blank1_km2 = |area_blank1_sq_mi = |population_as_of = 2003 |population_footnotes = |population_note = |population_total = 7,176 |population_density_km2 = |population_density_sq_mi = |timezone = |utc_offset = |timezone_DST = |utc_offset_DST = |coordinates = |elevation_footnotes = |elevation_m = |elevation_ft = |postal_code_type = |website = |footnotes = }} Mobaye is a settlement with a population of 7,176 (2003 census) in the Basse-Kotto prefecture of Central African Republic. It lies on the Ubangi River. == History == left|thumb|Anti-balaka fighter in Mobaye, 2019 On 8 February 2013 Mobaye was captured by Séléka rebels.Situation Report No. 6 (as of 18 February 2013) In September 2019 Mobaye was reportedly under joint control of Anti- balaka and Union for Peace in the Central African Republic.Letter dated 6 December 2019 from the Panel of Experts on the Central African Republic extended pursuant to resolution 2454 (2019) addressed to the President of the Security Council , page 26 On 4 May 2021 Mobaye was recaptured by government forces.RCA : la ville de Mobaye, chef-lieu de la Basse-Kotto, a été reprise par les forces alliées ce mardi soir, 4 May 2021 ==References== Category:Sub- prefectures of the Central African Republic Category:Central African Republic–Democratic Republic of the Congo border crossings Category:Ubangi River Category:Populated places in Basse-Kotto
title: Mobaye
